11 void ParticleFilter::assign(const pdata_t value)
12 {
13  for(int i=0; i<nSubParticleSets_; ++i)
14  assign(value, i);

18 {

22 ParticleFilter::ParticleFilter(const uint nParticles, const uint nTargets, const uint statesPerRobot, const uint nRobots)
23  : nParticles_(nParticles), nTargets_(nTargets), nStatesPerRobot_(statesPerRobot), nRobots_(nRobots), nSubParticleSets_(nTargets*STATES_PER_TARGET + nRobots*statesPerRobot + 1),
24  particles_(nSubParticleSets_, subparticles_t(nParticles)), seed_(time(0)),
25  initialized_(false)
26 {
27  int size[2];
28  size[0] = (int)particles_.size();
29  size[1] = (int)particles_[0].size();
30 
31  ROS_INFO("Created particle filter with dimensions %d, %d", size[0], size[1]);
32 }

34 ParticleFilter::ParticleFilter(const ParticleFilter& other)
35  : nParticles_(other.nParticles_), nSubParticleSets_(other.nSubParticleSets_),
36  nStatesPerRobot_(other.nStatesPerRobot_), nRobots_(other.nRobots_),
37  particles_(other.nSubParticleSets_, subparticles_t(other.nParticles_)), seed_(time(0)),
38  initialized_(other.initialized_)
39 {
40  ROS_DEBUG("Creating copy of another pf");
41 
42  // Only thing left is to copy particle values
43  particles_ = other.particles_; //std::vector assignment operator! yay C++
44 }

46 ParticleFilter &ParticleFilter::operator=(const ParticleFilter &other)
47 {
48  // The default operator won't to because we don't want to pass the same RNG seed
49 
50  ROS_DEBUG("Copying a pf to another pf");
51 
52  nParticles_ = other.nParticles_;
53  nSubParticleSets_ = other.nSubParticleSets_;
54  nRobots_ = other.nRobots_;
55  nStatesPerRobot_ = other.nStatesPerRobot_;
56  initialized_ = other.initialized_;
57  particles_ = other.particles_;
58 }

60 // TODO set different values for position and orientation, targets, etc
61 // Simple version, use default values - randomize all values between [-10,10]
62 void ParticleFilter::init()
63 {
64  if (initialized_)
65  return;
66 
67  int lvalue = -10;
68  int rvalue = 10;
69 
70  std::vector<double> def((nSubParticleSets_ - 1) * 2);
71 
72  for (int i = 0; i < def.size(); i += 2)
73  {
74  def[i] = lvalue;
75  def[i + 1] = rvalue;
76  }
77 
78  // Call the custom function with these values
79  init(def);
80 }
81 
82 // Overloaded fucntion when using custom values
83 void ParticleFilter::init(const std::vector<double> custom)
84 {
85  if (initialized_)
86  return;
87 
88  ROS_INFO("Initializing particle filter");
89 
90  // For all subparticle sets except the particle weights
91  for (int i = 0; i < custom.size() / 2; ++i)
92  {
93  ROS_DEBUG("Values for distribution: %.4f %.4f", custom[2 * i],
94  custom[2 * i + 1]);
95 
96  boost::random::uniform_real_distribution<> dist(custom[2 * i],
97  custom[2 * i + 1]);
98 
99  // Sample a value from the uniform distribution for each particle
100  BOOST_FOREACH (pdata_t& val, particles_[i])
101  {
102  val = dist(seed_);
103  }
104  }
105 
106  // Particle weights init with same weight (1/nParticles)
107  particles_[nSubParticleSets_ - 1].assign(nParticles_, 1 / nParticles_);
108 
109  // Set flag
110  initialized_ = true;
111 
112  ROS_INFO("Particle filter initialized");
113 }
114 
115 void ParticleFilter::predict(uint robotNumber,
116  const Eigen::Isometry2d& odometry)
117 {
118  if (!initialized_)
119  return;
120 
121  Eigen::Isometry2d prevParticle, curParticle;
122 
123  // use non-0-index logic (copied value)
124  robotNumber--;
125 
126  // lock mutex
127  boost::mutex::scoped_lock(mutex);
128 
129  for (uint i = 0; i < nParticles_; i++)
130  {
131  prevParticle = Eigen::Rotation2Dd(particles_[2 + robotNumber * 3][i])
132  .toRotationMatrix();
133  prevParticle.translation() =
134  Eigen::Vector2d(particles_[0 + (robotNumber - 1) * 3][i],
135  particles_[1 + (robotNumber - 1) * 3][i]);
136  curParticle = prevParticle * odometry;
137  particles_[0 + (robotNumber - 1) * 3][i] = curParticle.translation()[0];
138  particles_[1 + (robotNumber - 1) * 3][i] = curParticle.translation()[1];
139  Eigen::Matrix<double, 2, 2> r_particle = curParticle.linear();
140  double angle_particle = acos(r_particle(0, 0));
141  particles_[2 + (robotNumber - 1) * 3][i] = angle_particle;
142  }
143 }
144
